interface.name: GifLib
interface.summary: GifLib: library and tools for GIF images
interface.description: The giflib package contains a shared library of functions for loading and saving GIF format image files.

entry-point.name: Gifinfo
entry-point.summary: Gifinfo: display information about GIF files
entry-point.description: A program to display information (size and comment) of GIF files.

entry-point.summary: Gif2epsn: dump GIF images on Epson type printers
entry-point.description: A program to dump images saved as GIF files on Epson type printers.

entry-point.summary: Gif2ps: GIF-to-PostScript conversion
entry-point.description: GIF-to-PostScript conversion.

entry-point.summary: Gif2rgb: convert GIF images to 24-bit RGB image(s)
entry-point.description: A program to convert images saved as GIF to 24-bit RGB image(s).

entry-point.summary: Gif2rle: convert GIF images to RLE (Utah raster toolkit) format
Gifasm: (dis)assemble multiple GIF files into one
entry-point.description: A program to assemble multiple GIF files into one, or disassemble a single GIF file with multiple images into single image files.

entry-point.summary: Gifbg: generate a single-color test pattern GIF with gradient
entry-point.description: A program to generate a single-color test pattern GIF with gradually changing intensity in any of the basic 8 directions.

entry-point.summary: Gifclip: clip images in GIF file
entry-point.description: Only one image in a GIF file can be modified at a time. Neither the image position on screen nor the screen size is modified (use gifpos for that)

entry-point.summary: Gifclrmp: modify GIF image colormaps
entry-point.description: A program to modify GIF image colormaps. Any local col- ormap in a GIF file can be modified at a time, or the global screen one.

entry-point.summary: Gifcolor: generate color test patterns
entry-point.description: A program to generate color test patterns.

entry-point.summary: Gifcomb: combine 2 GIF images into one
entry-point.description: A program to combine 2 GIF images of exactly the same size into one. The color maps are merged, but the result may not exceed 256 colors. A boolean mask GIF file can be used to set which pixel from two images to use at each location. Otherwise any background color from first image is converted to second image color at that point. Only the first image of each file is com- bined; again, all files' first images must be of exactly the same size.

entry-point.summary: Giffiltr: copy a gif
entry-point.description: This is an expensive way to copy a GIF. The source is included as a skeleton for more sophisticated filters. See the source in the util directory for details.

entry-point.summary: Giffix: attempt to fix broken packages
entry-point.description: A program that attempts to fix broken GIF images. Cur- rently will "fix" images terminated prematurely by fill- ing the rest of the image with the darkest color found in image.

entry-point.summary: Gifflip: flip (mirror) GIF file
entry-point.description: A program to flip (mirror) GIF file along X or Y axes, or rotate the GIF file 90 degrees to the left or to the right.

entry-point.summary: Gifhisto: create histogram of number of pixels using each color
entry-point.description: A program to create histogram of number of pixels using each color. The output can be formatted into a GIF his- togram file, or as text file - both go to stdout.

entry-point.summary: Gifinter: convert between interlaced and non-interlaced GIF images
entry-point.description: A program to convert between interlaced and non-inter- laced GIF images.

entry-point.summary: Gifinto: save stdin into a file with given name
entry-point.description: A program to save stdin into a file with given name, if the result file has size bigger than specified (see below). This can be used to save result in same files name we started a chain of pipes.

entry-point.summary: Gifovly: convert a multi-image GIF file into a single GIF
entry-point.description: This program takes a multi-image GIF file and generates a single GIF consisting of all the images overlayed. Each image's screen position is used. Thus, you can use this together with gifpos and gifasm to paste together images.

entry-point.summary: Gifpos: change GIF screen size and/or reposition images
entry-point.description: A program to change GIF screen size and/or reposition images. No test is made to make sure changes will gen- erate valid GIF files (i.e. images are still confined to screen etc.)

entry-point.summary: Gifrotat: rotate a GIF image by a specified angle
entry-point.description: A program to rotate a GIF image by a specified angle.

entry-point.summary: Gifrsize: resize image size by an integer factor
entry-point.description: A program to resize image size by an integer factor, deleting bits when scaling down and duplicating bits when scaling up.

entry-point.summary: Gifspnge: expensive way to copy a GIF
entry-point.description: This is an expensive way to copy a GIF. The source is included as a skeleton for more sophisticated filters using DGifSlurp() and EGifSpew(). See the source in the util directory for details.

entry-point.summary: Giftext: dump (text only) general information about GIF file
entry-point.description: A program to dump (text only) general information about GIF file.

entry-point.summary: Gifwedge: create a test GIF image
entry-point.description: A program to create a test GIF image with intensity lev- els of the RGB colors YCM colors and white.

entry-point.summary: Icon2gif: create multi-image GIF
entry-point.description: A program to convert a series of editable text GIF icon specifications and named GIF files into a multi-image GIF, usable as a graphic resource file. It can also dump existing GIFs in this format.

entry-point.summary: Raw2gif: convert RAW image data into GIF files
entry-point.description: A program to convert RAW image data into GIF files. Only one image can be handled. The RAW image file is assumed to hold one pixel color in one byte, and there- fore the file size must be Width times Height as speci- fied by the -s option below.

entry-point.summary: Rgb2gif: convert 24 bit images to a GIF
entry-point.description: A program to convert 24 bit images to a GIF image using color quantization.

entry-point.name: GifLib
entry-point.summary: Rle2gif: convert RLE (Utah raster toolkit) format to GIF images
Text2gif: generate GIF images out of regular text
entry-point.description: A program to generate GIF images out of regular text. Text can be one line or multi-line, and is converted using 8 by 8 fixed font.

entry-point.summary: gifburst: This program breaks into equal-sized tiles a GIF image.
entry-point.description: The gifburst program takes a named GIF file and breaks it into equal-sized tiles. This is useful if a GIF is too large for your viewer, so you have to look at it in sections.

entry-point.summary: gifcompose: a GIF compositor
entry-point.description: The gifcompose tool takes a series of text lines and interprets them as commands to do pasteup operations. Text directives may be generators, modifiers, target operations and comments.
